intro: [WRONG START] Prunus cerasis var. semperflorens, commonly known as the cherry laurel or everblooming cherry. This plant is a cultivar of the Prunus cerasus species, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and abundant white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 10 feet, with dark green leaves that provide year-round visual interest. The flowers are highly fragrant and attract pollinators, while the plant is relatively drought-tolerant once established. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil types.
